header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

response.body:
{"result":"success","message":"","code":0, "data": [{"name":"NEIL DEMMAR","company":null,"title":null,"text":"Attaining CASC status means a lot to Blandford Rugby Club as it opens up funding opportunities and we can now receive Gift Aid. This means we can afford better facilities and it encourages other organisations to help us on a local level. We appreciate Ward Goodman helping us to achieve this important goal.","image":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/adwayusa/website/SS.jpg"},{"name":"Rick Smith","company":"Age Concern Hampshire","title":null,"text":"I have found the whole team at ADWAY to be both professional and efficient in all aspects of their work – they are ever supportive and empowering, allowing my organisation to excel at the things we do best, secure in the knowledge we have their support and guidance every step of the way.","image":null},{"name":" J Pentney","company":"Blandford RFC","title":"CEO","text":"

I have been asked by the committee of Blandford Rugby Football Club to write to you to express our appreciation for the guidance and administration work which has been undertaken by you and your colleagues to enable the club to achieve Limited Company and Community Amateur Sports Club Accreditation. Both of these achievements will enable the club to progress and provide rugby for future generations.

Blandford Rugby Football Club looks forward to continuing our association with your company in the future.
","image":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/adwayusa/website/images2.jpg"},{"name":"NEIL DEMMAR","company":null,"title":null,"text":"Attaining CASC status means a lot to Blandford Rugby Club as it opens up funding opportunities and we can now receive Gift Aid. This means we can afford better facilities and it encourages other organisations to help us on a local level. We appreciate Ward Goodman helping us to achieve this important goal.","image":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/adwayusa/website/SS.jpg"},{"name":"Rick Smith","company":"Age Concern Hampshire","title":null,"text":"I have found the whole team at ADWAY to be both professional and efficient in all aspects of their work – they are ever supportive and empowering, allowing my organisation to excel at the things we do best, secure in the knowledge we have their support and guidance every step of the way.","image":null},{"name":" J Pentney","company":"Blandford RFC","title":"CEO","text":"

I have been asked by the committee of Blandford Rugby Football Club to write to you to express our appreciation for the guidance and administration work which has been undertaken by you and your colleagues to enable the club to achieve Limited Company and Community Amateur Sports Club Accreditation. Both of these achievements will enable the club to progress and provide rugby for future generations.

Blandford Rugby Football Club looks forward to continuing our association with your company in the future.
","image":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/adwayusa/website/images2.jpg"}]}

header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

item.description:
Public accesable functions to return data used in the application.
List of the countries for example.

item.name: App version control

request.description:
We send current app version in follow format
{
    "API_KEY": "{{$API_KEY}}",
    "data":{ "VERSION": "1.2.3" }
}

We get back answer in follow format
{"result":"success","message":"","code":0, "data": 
    [{
    	"updateStatus":5
    	"title": "WARNING",
    	"message": "Update as soon as possible",
    	"serverVersion": "1.5.1",
    	"appVersion": "1.5.1"
    	
    }]}

Status codes
    0  - All up to date.
    5  - Show warning to the user bu let hin go to next screen.
    10 - Block user. He must update application.
    
  title - Alert title.
  message - Alert text.
  
  ********************I am not sure do we need this fields or not ********************
  serverVersion - current server version
  appVersion - latest app version

item.description: This functions control current app compatibility and prevent user to run old version uncompatable with current interface.
